title: Cal Crutchlow interview: British MotoGP hero talks about the racer's need for speed
text:
Squat, with an unfaltering stare, prominent sinews and a wit as sharp as his reactions while jostling a 225mph MotoGP prototype motorcycle, Cal Crutchlow is an uncomplicated and ‘old-fashioned’ racer: a 33-year-old with a hobbled right ankle that will either harry and hassle the likes of current world champion Marc Marquez and series superstar Valentino Rossi or be contemplating the rash of gravel stones.

For many Crutchlow will be the point of attention this weekend when Grand Prix motorcycling returns to the UK and to a resurfaced (and optimistic) Silverstone. The Northamptonshire circuit hopes its 20th running of the event – one of three original fixtures from the first 1949 FIM Road Racing...
